link.title: Pre-Match Briefing: Burnley vs Chelsea

newsFeed.content: Pre-Match Briefing: Burnley vs Chelsea
newsFeed.description: Back from southern Russia and quickly up to northern England – attention switches back to the Premier League this weekend. Club historian Rick Glanvill and club statistician Paul Dutton look ahead to Saturday afternoon at Turf Moor…

link.title: Billy Gilmour reveals the three team-mates he would spend a night in a haunted house with!

newsFeed.content: Billy Gilmour reveals the three team-mates he would spend a night in a haunted house with!
newsFeed.description: ‘The scariest thing I’ve seen on a football pitch?’ Billy Gilmour asks. ‘That has to be Toni Rudiger chasing me down when I have the ball!’

link.title: Burnley vs Chelsea - the stats - chance to maintain good Turf Moor record

newsFeed.content: Burnley vs Chelsea - the stats - chance to maintain good Turf Moor record
newsFeed.description: Our third away game in a row takes us to Turf Moor, a happy hunting ground in recent years, and we begin our preview of the game by taking a closer look at all the stats and facts...

link.title: Quiz: How well do you remember our last visit to Burnley?

newsFeed.content: Quiz: How well do you remember our last visit to Burnley?
newsFeed.description: Ahead of Saturday's Premier League match against Burnley find out how well you remember last season's away trip to Turf Moor.

newsFeed.description: In our look at the latest Chelsea-related news stories from the media, new signing Ben Chilwell reveals he went through a crisis in confidence last year.

link.title: Youth Cup semi-final preview: Happy to conclude last season's work

newsFeed.content: Youth Cup semi-final preview: Happy to conclude last season's work
newsFeed.description: Under-18s head coach Ed Brand is back in the dugout on the big FA Youth Cup stage tonight and admits the opportunity for his players to continue a campaign in which they worked so hard is the most pleasing part of the competition resuming and concluding at St George's Park this weekend...

link.title: Lampard latest on absent duo, working in a positive direction and Pulisic’s progression

newsFeed.content: Lampard latest on absent duo, working in a positive direction and Pulisic’s progression
newsFeed.description: Frank Lampard has reported no new injury concerns following our midweek exertions in Russia as preparations quickly begin ahead of our Saturday afternoon trip to Burnley in the Premier League.

link.title: Giles Smith: Hang on - were those fans I saw?

newsFeed.content: Giles Smith: Hang on - were those fans I saw?

author.description: Giles Smith has been giving a supporter’s eye view on all matters Chelsea in a weekly column since 2006. A Matthew Harding Stand upper tier season ticket holders, he has been a supporter since 1970 and was briefly the proud sponsor of Gareth Hall's shorts. A former Sports Columnist of the Year, writes for the Times, and has appeared in many British publications and is the author of two books: 'Lost in Music', an autobiographical account of his failure to become a globe-girdling rock star, and 'Midnight In the Garden of Evel Kneivel', a book about sport on television. His column on chelseafc.com will be back for the new season.

newsFeed.description: It’s approaching eight months since Chelsea season ticket holder Giles Smith last took his seat in the Matthew Harding Upper, but, watching our game in Krasnodar on television, he noticed a most alien concept off the pitch as the Blues ran riot on it…

link.title: Timo Werner reflects on resilience shown to withstand pressure and penalty-taking options

image.alt: Werner celebrates his goal against Krasnodar

media.caption: Werner celebrates his goal against Krasnodar

newsFeed.content: Timo Werner reflects on resilience shown to withstand pressure and penalty-taking options
newsFeed.description: Timo Werner’s first Champions League goal for Chelsea helped the Blues to a convincing victory in Russia on Wednesday evening, although the German insisted afterwards that the 4-0 final scoreline perhaps did not fully reflect the stubborn test provided by Krasnodar.

link.title: High-scoring night for Play Predictor fans

newsFeed.content: High-scoring night for Play Predictor fans
newsFeed.description: There were plenty of goals on the pitch for Chelsea and plenty of points off it for Blues fans on Play Predictor on Wednesday thanks to our 4-0 victory over Krasnodar.

link.title: The Debrief: All-round Havertz and the wizardry of Ziyech

newsFeed.content: The Debrief: All-round Havertz and the wizardry of Ziyech
newsFeed.description: Our forensic look at the statistics from last night’s victory away to Krasnodar brings to light the impact Kai Havertz and Hakim Ziyech had on our attacking play…

link.title: Youth Cup semi-final preview: Anjorin hoping to lead by example

newsFeed.content: Youth Cup semi-final preview: Anjorin hoping to lead by example
newsFeed.description: On Friday night at St George's Park, the national football centre, Chelsea Under-18s take on Manchester United for a place in the final of the resumed 2019/20 FA Youth Cup. You can watch how the team get on live on BT Sport, kick-off 7:45pm.

link.title: Lampard launches season two of Hyundai FC

newsFeed.content: Lampard launches season two of Hyundai FC
newsFeed.description: Frank Lampard joined 11 young grassroots footballers online to celebrate the start of the second season of the Hyundai FC programme.

link.title: Hudson-Odoi: Champions League goals were deserved

newsFeed.content: Hudson-Odoi: Champions League goals were deserved
newsFeed.description: It was not the perfect performance in Russia on Wednesday night reckoned opening goalscorer Callum Hudson-Odoi when he spoke after the game, but the 4-0 result showed the players carried out Frank Lampard’s game plan well.

link.title: Rennes programme available now, featuring Kai Havertz exclusive

newsFeed.content: Rennes programme available now, featuring Kai Havertz exclusive
newsFeed.description: After the Blues’ thumping win over Krasnodar last night, our next Champions League matchday programme is available to order now, featuring an in-depth interview with new signing Kai Havertz.

link.title: Lampard praises Ziyech and Hudson-Odoi’s impact; happy owner saw a good performance

newsFeed.content: Lampard praises Ziyech and Hudson-Odoi’s impact; happy owner saw a good performance
newsFeed.description: It was the performance of Hakim Ziyech that caught the eye in tonight’s resounding 4-0 victory over Krasnodar, and Frank Lampard spoke of his satisfaction at being able to use the Moroccan from the start for the first time and watch him truly announce himself as a Chelsea player.

link.title: Quiz! Can you name the 10 teams Chelsea have never beaten?

newsFeed.content: Quiz! Can you name the 10 teams Chelsea have never beaten?

link.title: Chelsea signs up for Football Leadership Diversity Code

newsFeed.description: The Football Association has today launched the Football Leadership Diversity Code to drive diversity and inclusion in English football, with Chelsea one of the first clubs committing to tackling inequality across senior leadership positions, broader team operations and coaching roles.

link.title: Pat Nevin: Fresh legs needed for exciting trip into the unknown?

newsFeed.content: Pat Nevin: Fresh legs needed for exciting trip into the unknown?

author.description: Pat Nevin has been a regular contributor on the official Chelsea website since 2006, bringing his expertise and analysis to the club he lit up as a quick-footed, imaginative and highly entertaining winger in the 1980s, playing over 250 games. He has written about football for many years and is a leading expert on TV and radio, including regular appearances on Chelsea TV and in the club’s matchday programme.

newsFeed.description: On the back of a draw at Old Trafford which is still rankling him, former Blue Pat Nevin looks forward to a long first European trip of the season, including the tactical and physical considerations that await Frank Lampard...

link.title: Giles Smith: An appreciation of the nil

author.description: Giles Smith has been giving a supporter’s eye view on all matters Chelsea in a weekly column since 2006. A Matthew Harding Stand upper tier season ticket holders, he has been a supporter since 1970 and was briefly the proud sponsor of Gareth Hall's shorts. A former Sports Columnist of the Year, writes for the Times, and has appeared in many British publications and is the author of two books: 'Lost in Music', an autobiographical account of his failure to become a globe-girdling rock star, and 'Midnight In the Garden of Evel Kneivel', a book about sport on television. His column on chelseafc.com will be back for the new season.

newsFeed.description: Our statistical analysis of yesterday’s game focuses on how we kept La Liga opposition at bay, with players contributing to that across the pitch…

link.title: Academy to take part in inaugural Under-17 Premier League Cup

newsFeed.content: Academy to take part in inaugural Under-17 Premier League Cup
newsFeed.description: Our youngsters will compete in a new Premier League competition this season and have been drawn into a group alongside Reading, Southampton and Fulham.

link.title: Watch Edouard Mendy and Hakim Ziyech press conferences live

newsFeed.content: Watch Edouard Mendy and Hakim Ziyech press conferences live
newsFeed.description: Two of our summer recruits, Edouard Mendy and Hakim Ziyech, will be answering questions from the media in press conferences at Cobham on Thursday afternoon and you can watch live right here on the official Chelsea website.

link.title: Chilwell: Putting a shift in

newsFeed.content: Chilwell: Putting a shift in
newsFeed.description: Ben Chilwell has highlighted the importance of the clean sheet against Sevilla and praised the attacking players for their work helping the defence.

link.title: Media Watch: Chelsea’s defensive display lauded by ex-Blues star, Azpilicueta gives half-time talk to non-league side, Sarri linked with new coaching job

newsFeed.content: Media Watch: Chelsea’s defensive display lauded by ex-Blues star, Azpilicueta gives half-time talk to non-league side, Sarri linked with new coaching job
newsFeed.description: In our look at the latest Chelsea-related news stories from the media, former Blue Joe Cole reacts to our goalless draw against Sevilla in the Champions League.

link.title: Halloween family fun at Stamford Bridge including ghoulish stadium tours

newsFeed.content: Halloween family fun at Stamford Bridge including ghoulish stadium tours
newsFeed.description: Halloween is almost here and what better way to mark the occasion than an evening roaming the corridors of Stamford Bridge with a special spooky stadium tour...

link.title: Watch Chelsea Women’s Conti Cup game against Spurs live!

newsFeed.content: Watch Chelsea Women’s Conti Cup game against Spurs live!
newsFeed.description: Emma Hayes’ Blues are next in action on Tuesday 3 November when we take on Tottenham Hotspur in the Continental League Cup and the game will be shown live on various official Chelsea platforms free of charge.

link.title: Lampard: Clean sheet is big deal, Thiago Silva big plus, Mendy no.1

newsFeed.content: Lampard: Clean sheet is big deal, Thiago Silva big plus, Mendy no.1
newsFeed.description: Frank Lampard looked back to Champions League matchday one from his first season as Chelsea boss when he analysed Tuesday evening’s 0-0 draw with Sevilla at Stamford Bridge, and he also gave his verdict on one of his defenders and his goalkeeper.

link.title: Match Report: Chelsea 0 Sevilla 0

newsFeed.content: Match Report: Chelsea 0 Sevilla 0
newsFeed.description: The first-ever competitive meeting between Chelsea and Sevilla will not go down as a classic although both sides are likely to view the draw as a reasonably steady start to their Champions League campaigns, with these the two favourites to top the group.

link.title: Lampard: Cech in the squad a ‘no-brainer’

newsFeed.content: Lampard: Cech in the squad a ‘no-brainer’
newsFeed.description: Frank Lampard has been explaining the decision to add Petr Cech to the Premier League squad submitted for the rest of the season, insisting it is not done for ‘the romance’ of an all-time Chelsea great potentially lining up between the posts in a game again, a scenario he thinks unlikely, but that it makes total sense in the current climate.

link.title: Chelsea line up vs Sevilla

newsFeed.content: Chelsea line up vs Sevilla
newsFeed.description: Edouard Mendy returns in goal having missed the weekend match against Southampton due to injury.

link.title: Chelsea's Premier League squad named

newsFeed.content: Chelsea's Premier League squad named
newsFeed.description: Following the end of the domestic summer transfer window last week, the Chelsea squad for league action this season has now been submitted to the Premier League.

link.title: Who's scored against Spanish opposition?

image.alt: drogba and Lampard in Champions League training

newsFeed.content: Who's scored against Spanish opposition?
newsFeed.description: As Chelsea prepare to open our Champions League campaign against Sevilla, we look back at some of our goalscoring heroes against Spanish opposition in years gone by. Who has been a pain to those from Spain most often?

link.title: Pat Nevin: What do Sevilla think of the Premier League right now?

newsFeed.content: Pat Nevin: What do Sevilla think of the Premier League right now?

author.description: Pat Nevin has been a regular contributor on the official Chelsea website since 2006, bringing his expertise and analysis to the club he lit up as a quick-footed, imaginative and highly entertaining winger in the 1980s, playing over 250 games. He has written about football for many years and is a leading expert on TV and radio, including regular appearances on Chelsea TV and in the club’s matchday programme.

newsFeed.description: With the nature of English top-flight games in 2020/21 continuing to generate plenty of discussion and European competition about to join the fray, former Blue Pat Nevin looks at how modern football mixes with the old, including a ‘timeless’ Timo Werner goal…

link.title: Pre-Match Briefing: Chelsea vs Sevilla

newsFeed.content: Pre-Match Briefing: Chelsea vs Sevilla
newsFeed.description: From south-west Spain to south-west London, the Champions League group stage brings Sevilla to town for the opener. Club historian Rick Glanvill and club statistician Paul Dutton have the talking points ahead of Tuesday evening’s match…

link.title: Indian Blues predict more goals for Werner

newsFeed.content: Indian Blues predict more goals for Werner
newsFeed.description: The latest Play Predictor guests, our Kerala Official Supporters’ Club from India, are backing Timo Werner to get us off to a winning start in the Champions League.

link.title: Media Watch: Sevilla manager believes Chelsea can win Champions League, Werner in BBC Team of the Week, former Blue shines on Premier League return

newsFeed.content: Media Watch: Sevilla manager believes Chelsea can win Champions League, Werner in BBC Team of the Week, former Blue shines on Premier League return
newsFeed.description: In our look at the latest Chelsea-related news stories from the media, Sevilla manager Julen Lopetegui gives his opinion of the Blues ahead of tonight’s Champions League clash.

link.title: Lampard on Champions League lessons and an update on Gilmour’s recovery

newsFeed.content: Lampard on Champions League lessons and an update on Gilmour’s recovery
newsFeed.description: Europe’s premium club competition starts all over again tomorrow evening and Frank Lampard believes his Chelsea side will be well prepared for the test that awaits from Sevilla.
